main event: On 6 November 1954 in San Antonio, Texas, a white object was observed moving at a slow rate of speed, appeared to be suspended in the air, and then disappeared in 20 to 30 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 20 to 30 seconds before disappearing.
Investigation revealed a H-13 helicopter in the vicinity at the time of sighting, on approximately the same course as the unidentified object.

A witness, Lieutenant Miller, observed two unidentified silver circular objects approximately 40 feet in diameter, which appeared to be stationary, then accelerated and disappeared from view in San Antonio, Texas.

A civilian pilot of a private aircraft observed a stationary, hovering, and motionless round or disc-shaped object, estimated to be approximately 50 feet in diameter, with a metallic or aluminum-like surface coloration, at an estimated altitude of 15,000 feet above mean sea level.

A student pilot and instructor flying in a T-33 aircraft near San Antonio, Texas, observed an unidentified aerial object estimated to be traveling at approximately 3 to 4 times the speed of the T-33. The object made a very sharp, almost instantaneous turn of approximately 90 degrees to the left before accelerating rapidly and disappearing from sight.
sighted object: Multiple unidentified objects, including a white object, silver circular objects, and an oblong, maneuverable object
witnesses: Various witnesses including military personnel and civilian pilots
